alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 1:31PM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, The Mendenhall Valley including Mendenhall Lake and River, Auke Lake, Montana Creek, and Jordan Creek. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause minor flooding from overflow of poor drainage areas, especially near Mendenhall Lake and River, Montana Creek, Auke Lake and Jordan Creek. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 1:00pm the stage was 32.57 feet. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. For Jordan Creek near Juneau: At 1:00pm the stage was 9.39 feet. Flood Stage is 9.7 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.9 feet is expected around 4:00pm Thursday. For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 1:00pm the stage was 14.65 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 15.84 feet is expected around 10:00pm Thursday. For Mendenhall Lake : At 1:15pm the stage was 6.94 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.24 feet is expected around 4:00am Friday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
